configuration.label: Site logo
configuration.description: A company logo that will be displayed on all pages on your documentation site. We recommend using a 200 x 30px .svg or .png file.

configuration.label: Site logo height
configuration.description: The height of your site logo in the top navigation bar, measured in pixels.

configuration.label: Site favicon
configuration.description: The favicon that will be used for your documentation site. We recommend using a 32 x 32px .png file. Using legacy .ico is not recommended.

configuration.label: Accent color
configuration.description: This is your main accent color, used for all links, selected states, and active items. Default color: #0f62fe.

configuration.label: Alternative accent color
configuration.description: Used in hover states for links, selected items, and active states. Usually darker or lighter than the main accent color. Default color: #0043ce.

configuration.label: Surface accent color
configuration.description: Used for backgrounds of active and selected items. This color should meet AA+ contract criteria against the main accent color. Default color: #ecf4ff.

configuration.label: Icon stroke width
configuration.description: The stroke width for all icons, measured in pixels. Default width: 2px.
Font used in published documentation. If you use a custom font family (e.g. from Google Fonts), you might need to embed it below.
configuration.label: Font family
Custom font embed
configuration.description: Fonts that will be added to your site <head> (e.g. for typography token previews). You can load multiple fonts if needed.

configuration.label: Theme overrides
configuration.description: Overrides of CSS custom properties (variables) for the theme. You can use this to change the look and feel of the published documentation.

configuration.label: Custom CSS
configuration.description: Need even more customization? You can add custom CSS, which will override everything before it. Please note, there is some risk that the CSS classes and DOM structure may change in the future.

configuration.label: Limit maximum site width
configuration.description: On big screens, the side navigation will be aligned to the left of the content.

configuration.label: Maximum site width
configuration.description: The maximum site width, measured in pixels. This applies if you have chosen to limit the maximum site width. Minimum width: 1400px.

configuration.label: Content container width
configuration.description: The maximum width of the content container, measured in pixels. Default (and minimum) width: 756px.

configuration.label: Color style
configuration.description: The overall color style used for the top navigation throughout your published documentation.

configuration.label: Background color
configuration.description: Used for the background of the top navigation bar. Should be complementary to your selected color style.

configuration.label: Height
configuration.description: Used to set the height of your top navigation bar, measured in pixels. Minimum height: 44px.

configuration.label: Search button type
configuration.description: The type of the search button in top navigation.

configuration.label: Show version dropdown
configuration.description: When enabled, the version dropdown will be shown in your documentation, allowing visitors to select which version they'd like to see.

configuration.label: Show CTA in site header
configuration.description: When enabled, a CTA button will be added to the top navigation bar in your documentation. You can then  add the link and CTA text of your choice.

configuration.label: Site CTA: Label
configuration.description: The text for the CTA button in your top navigation bar.

configuration.label: Site CTA: Link
configuration.description: The URL you want the CTA button in your top navigation bar to link to.

configuration.label: Site CTA: Open in new tab
configuration.description: When enabled, the link will open in a new tab once the user clicks on the CTA button.

configuration.label: Hide top navigation
configuration.description: When enabled, the top navigation bar will be completely hidden, and only the side navigation will be shown, with logo and search icon at the top of it.

configuration.label: Color style
configuration.description: The overall color style used for the side navigation throughout your published documentation.

configuration.label: Background color
configuration.description: Used for the background of the side navigation. Should be complementary to your selected color style.

configuration.label: Show section label
configuration.description: When enabled, a section label will be displayed at the top of the side navigation.

configuration.label: Expand the first level of navigation
configuration.description: When enabled, all first-level groups will be expanded, and the group label will be styled as an eyebrow heading. This won't be applied to pages with tabs.

configuration.label: Show page tabs in navigation
configuration.description: When enabled, page tabs will be displayed in the side navigation.

configuration.label: Show Supernova branding
configuration.description: When enabled, "Powered by Supernova" will be displayed at the bottom of the side navigation. Optional, but highly appreciated ‚ô•Ô∏è

configuration.label: Show navigation at bottom of page
configuration.description: When enabled, navigation will be displayed at the bottom of the homepage allowing visitors to navigate to the next documentation page.

configuration.label: Show table of contents
configuration.description: When enabled, a table of contents will be displayed on the homepage.

configuration.label: Override homepage label in menus
configuration.description: E.g. Home. When defined, it'll be used as a menu label for homepage in published documentation. This will allow you to have e.g. 'Welcome to our design system' as your page title for the homepage without displaying it in menus.

configuration.label: Page header style
configuration.description: The visual style of the header in your documentation. Choose between Default (edge to edge) and Boxed (with space surrounding the header).

configuration.label: Default page header image
configuration.description: The default background image used in the page header throughout your documentation. You can still choose a different image for individual pages. If none is uploaded, no image will be used.

configuration.label: Main background color in page header
configuration.description: The background color used in the page header throughout your documentation. You can still choose a different color for individual pages.

configuration.label: Default page title color
configuration.description: The page title color throughout your documentation. You can still choose a different page title color for individual pages.

configuration.label: Default page header height
configuration.description: The height of the page header throughout your documentation, measured in pixels. You can still choose a different height for individual pages. To enable automatic height adjustment based on the page header content, enter a value of 0px.

configuration.label: Show table of contents
configuration.description: When enabled, a table of contents will be displayed on each page.

configuration.label: Custom label for table of contents
configuration.description: Customize the label for the table of contents section on each page.

configuration.label: Hide Heading 3 from table of contents
configuration.description: When enabled, all Heading 3 levels will be hidden in table of contents.

configuration.label: Show navigation at bottom of page
configuration.description: When enabled, navigation will be displayed at the bottom of each page allowing visitors to navigate to the previous, and next, documentation page.

configuration.label: Show footer
configuration.description: A small footer on each page will be displayed.

configuration.label: Show last published date
configuration.description: When enabled, the date on which the page was last published will be displayed in the footer.

configuration.label: Show custom footer
configuration.description: A custom footer will be added on top of the regular footer. Great for additional links, information, etc.

configuration.label: Edit custom footer using HTML code
configuration.description: If a custom footer is enabled, you can edit the custom footer by changing its HTML representation. Any HTML will work.
configuration.default:
My Doc Site

This footer can be completely changed through Supernova customization options. Head to site advanced customization to learn more!

Resources
  • Changelog
  • Storybook
  • Figma
Support
  • Report issue
  • Terms & Conditions
  • Privacy Policy

configuration.label: Allow search engine indexing
configuration.description: If enabled, your documentation site will be indexable by search engines. Note that only public documentation sites can be indexed.

configuration.label: Allow search engines to follow links
configuration.description: If enabled, search engine robots will 'follow' the links on your indexed documentation pages.

configuration.label: Generate sitemap.xml
configuration.description: If enabled, your documentation sitemap will be automatically regenerated every time you publish.

configuration.label: Site thumbnail image
configuration.description: The site thumbnail will use this image. If no image is uploaded, the thumbnail will be empty.

configuration.label: Site title prefix
configuration.description: If provided, page title will be prepended with this text.

configuration.label: Site title suffix
configuration.description: When provided, page title will be appended with this text.

configuration.label: Site title override
configuration.description: This string of text will completely override the site title on all documentation pages.

configuration.label: Site description prefix
configuration.description: When provided, page description will be prepended with this string.

configuration.label: Site description suffix
configuration.description: When provided, page description will be appended with this string.
configuration.default: | Design system documentation, made with ‚ù§Ô∏è using Supernova

configuration.label: Site description
configuration.description: This string of text will be used as the main page description for all documentation pages. If empty, the page description will be dynamically generated from the page subheader (if any) or its content.

configuration.label: Google Analytics Measurement ID
configuration.description: Add Google Analytics tracking to your documentation site by providing a Measurement ID. You must set it up as Google Analytics 4 (recommended).

configuration.label: Intercom API key
configuration.description: Add Intercom to your documentation site by providing an API key.

configuration.label: Hotjar site ID
configuration.description: Add Hotjar to your documentation site by providing a Site ID.

configuration.label: Show cookies banner
configuration.description: If enabled, a cookies banner will be displayed on your documentation site. This banner will give users option to allow tracking cookies.

configuration.label: Cookies banner: Description
configuration.default: We use cookies to personalize content and analyze traffic to our documentation.

configuration.label: Editable React widgets
configuration.description: When a React code block is used, viewers of the documentation can edit the code to see the components change in real-time.

configuration.label: Open in Codesandbox.io
configuration.description: When a React code block is used,  viewers of the documentation can open its code and play around with it in codesandbox.io.

configuration.label: Enable Lottie player
configuration.description: The Lottie Player will be enabled in your documentation, and allow Lottie videos to play. Please note: this will add around 250 Kb to the initial page load of your documentation.

configuration.label: Private Markdown token
configuration.description: If provided, your markdown will be authenticated using this token. The token can contain its type , format: ['basic' | 'Bearer' | 'token'] [token]. If no type of format is provided, 'token' is assumed.

configuration.label: Custom <head> code
configuration.description: Any custom <head> code you want to inject into the head. You can add new meta tags, CSS or JS using this method. Please note, this is at your own risk!

configuration.label: Custom CSS (deprecated, do not use)
configuration.description: Deprecated custom CSS. The content of this field will not applied to published documentation site.

blocks.title: Markdown
blocks.description: Embed and process markdown from remote URL

blocks.title: Component Status (R7)
blocks.description: Show component status across Figma, Storybook and Supernova

blocks.title: Component Health
blocks.description: Show component health and additional attributes

blocks.title: Release Notes
blocks.description: Show formatted release notes from all previously released versions

blocks.title: Component Checklist
blocks.description: Highlight specific properties of your components

blocks.title: Component Overview Table
blocks.description: Show the overview of all of your components

Tabs.name: Tabs
Tabs.description: Tabs displayed at the top of the container.

Tabs.name: Pills
Tabs.description: Tabs displayed vertically at the left side of the container.

Tabs.name: Columns
Tabs.description: Tab content displayed as vertical columns of the same width. Experimental.

TokenList.description: Great for longer list of tokens, with a small side preview.

TokenList.name: Grid (4 columns)
TokenList.description: Grid with 4 columns, and a large preview on top.

TokenList.name: Grid (3 columns)

TokenList.name: Color stack
TokenList.description: Full-width horizontal stack, perfect for color palettes.

TokenList.name: Color contrast grid
TokenList.description: Grid of color contrast ratios, perfect for color palettes.

Token.name: Grid Item (1/3 width)

Token.name: Grid Item (Full width)
Token.description: Full page width, with a large preview.

Token.name: Color stack item
Token.description: Full width of the page, great for color tokens.

Shortcuts.name: Image on top (4 columns)
Shortcuts.description: Four items in a row, each with a large image on top.

Shortcuts.name: Image on top (3 columns)
Shortcuts.description: Three items in a row, each with a large image on top.

Shortcuts.name: Image on top (2 columns)
Shortcuts.description: Two items in a row, each with a large image on top.

Shortcuts.name: Image on top (Full width)
Shortcuts.description: One full-width item, with a large image on top.

Shortcuts.name: Leading image (2 columns)
Shortcuts.description: Two items in a row, each with a large image on the left.

Shortcuts.name: Leading image (Full width)
Shortcuts.description: One full-width item, with a large image on the left.

Shortcuts.name: Icon on top (4 columns)
Shortcuts.description: Four items in a row, each with a large icon on top.

Shortcuts.name: Icon on top (3 columns)
Shortcuts.description: Three items in a row, each with a large icon on top.

Shortcuts.name: Icon on top (2 columns)
Shortcuts.description: Two items in a row, each with a large icon on top.

Shortcuts.name: Leading icon (3 columns)
Shortcuts.description: Three items in a row, each with a large icon on the left.

Shortcuts.name: Leading icon (2 columns)

FigmaFrames.name: Boxed
FigmaFrames.description: Tiles with background and border, great for larger sets of frames.

FigmaFrames.name: Plain
FigmaFrames.description: Frame as it is in Figma with no extra formatting, great for single images.

RenderCode.name: Full width, code bottom
RenderCode.description: Full-width block of code, with a preview on top.

RenderCode.name: Full width, code top
RenderCode.description: Full-width block of code, with a preview on bottom.

RenderCode.name: Side by side, code left
RenderCode.description: Side-by-side preview and code, with code on the left.

RenderCode.name: Side by side, code right
RenderCode.description: Side-by-side preview and code, with code on the right.

RenderCode.name: Only preview, no code
RenderCode.description: Full-width preview only, with no code displayed.

RenderCode.name: Preview without controls
RenderCode.description: Full-width preview only, with no code and no controls.

io.supernova.documentation-main.markdown.name: Plain
io.supernova.documentation-main.markdown.description: Markdown displayed in natural page flow.

io.supernova.documentation-main.markdown.name: Bordered
io.supernova.documentation-main.markdown.description: Markdown wrapped in the container with subtle border.

io.supernova.documentation-main.markdown.name: Boxed
io.supernova.documentation-main.markdown.description: Markdown content wrapped in the container with secondary background.
